info.title: MapApp
info.description: An API for application, which helps delivery companies to plan their routes.

/data/profile/:id.description:
User profile is used to identify a user and allow to sign in to the application. 
Signed in user has more functionality as he/she can save different data associated with the user.

get.description:
| Requirement / Function | Is Required / Has |
| -------------------------- | ------------------  |
| Authentication                | yes |
| Authorization                  | only own |
| Pagination                       | no |
| Search                             | no |

delete.description:
| Requirement / Function | Is Required / Has |
| -------------------------- | ------------------  |
| Authentication                | yes |
| Authorization                  | only own |

/data/client.description:
Client is an object representing the client to whom a parcel should be delivered. It contains the Address object, which holds the Client address. While creating orders or calculating the route via Client id, Address of the Client will be used as a delivery address.
Notice that only registered users having created a Profile can save their Clients' data.

put.description:
| Requirement / Function | Is Required / Has |
| -------------------------- | ------------------  |
| Authentication                | yes  |
| Authorization                  | only own |

requestBody.description:
The recommended way of Client creation is with specifying an Address object. In some edge cases the addressId field can be used.
Notice that it is not possible to create the address object separately

post.description:
| Requirement / Function | Is Required / Has |
| -------------------------- | ------------------  |
| Authentication                | yes |
| Authorization                  | only own  |

/data/profile.description:
User profile is used to identify a user and allow to sign in to the application. 
Signed in user has more functionality as he/she can save different data associated with the user.

put.description:
| Requirement / Function | Is Required / Has |
| -------------------------- | ------------------  |
| Authentication                | yes  |
| Authorization                  | only own |

post.description:
| Requirement / Function | Is Required / Has |
| -------------------------- | ------------------  |
| Authentication                | no                        |
| Authorization                  | no                        |
| Pagination                       | no                        |
| Search                             | no                        |

APIErrorRes.description: Error response. Notice that errors field is always an array. Data can be ever empty object, null or undefined.

data.description: An empty object for the data field

APIError.description:
Interface for all errors, which may occur. Notice that the error has type property, which can be used for determining the object type and be parsed accordingly. If any unexpected errors occurred where will be additional field containing the error. The name field is common reason describing what kind of error happened and it is a enum value. The reason field is a concrete reason why the error happened and it is a enum value. The location field is describing possible error place in the request and it a enum value.

ErrorName enum:
| Key | Value |
| -------- | -------- |
| NOT_FOUND | 'NOT_FOUND' | 
| BAD_REQUEST | 'BAD_REQUEST' | 
| VALIDATION | 'VALIDATION' | 
| NOT_AUTHENTICATED | 'NOT_AUTHENTICATED' | 
| NOT_AUTHORIZED | 'NOT_AUTHORIZED' | 
| TOO_MANY_REQUESTS | 'TOO_MANY_REQUESTS' | 
| SERVER_ERROR | 'SERVER_ERROR' | 
| UNEXPECTED | 'UNEXPECTED' | 

ErrorReason enum:
| Key | Value |
| -------- | -------- |
| NOT_FOUND | 'NOT_FOUND' | 
| BAD_REQUEST | 'BAD_REQUEST' | 
| REQUIRED | 'REQUIRED' | 
| NOT_ALLOWED | 'NOT_ALLOWED' | 
| VALIDATION | 'VALIDATION' | 
| NOT_STRING | 'NOT_STRING' | 
| NOT_NUMBER | 'NOT_NUMBER' | 
| NOT_BOOLEAN | 'NOT_BOOLEAN' | 
| NOT_AUTHENTICATED | 'NOT_AUTHENTICATED' | 
| AUTH_TOKEN_NOT_PROVIDED | 'AUTH_TOKEN_NOT_PROVIDED' | 
| INVALID_AUTH_TOKEN_FORMAT | 'INVALID_AUTH_TOKEN_FORMAT' | 
| INVALID_AUTH_TOKEN | 'INVALID_AUTH_TOKEN' | 
| AUTHENTICATION_FAILED | 'AUTHENTICATION_FAILED' | 
| WRONG_CREDENTIALS | 'WRONG_CREDENTIALS' | 
| NOT_AUTHORIZED | 'NOT_AUTHORIZED' | 
| TOO_MANY_REQUESTS | 'TOO_MANY_REQUESTS' | 
| SERVER_MISCONFIGURED | 'SERVER_MISCONFIGURED' | 
| SERVER_ERROR | 'SERVER_ERROR' | 
| UNEXPECTED | 'UNEXPECTED' | 

ErrorLocation enum:
| Key | Value |
| -------- | -------- |
| HEADER | 'header' | 
| BODY | 'body' | 
| PARAM | 'param' | 
| QUERY | 'query' |

location.description: The approximate location of the error

endpoint.description: The endpoint where the error occurred

ClientCreateWithAddress.description: Client creation request body with Address

schema.description: "data"-field contains array of requested objects. "metadata"-field contains the pagination data

limit.description: The limit of items per page

201.description: Successfully created, response with created object.

204.description: Successful request, response with no body.

errors.message: Could not authenticate with provided token. Token is invalid or expired
errors.name: NOT_AUTHENTICATED

400.description: Authentication error response. It may occur if the request does not contain "Authorization" header with the Bearer token

errors.message: Could not authenticate with provided token. Token is invalid or expired
errors.name: NOT_AUTHENTICATED

401.description: Authentication error response. It may occur if the request does not contain "Authorization" header with the Bearer token

403.description: Authorization error response. It may occur if the user is not allowed to execute certain action

errors.message: User with that username already exists
errors.name: BAD_REQUEST

409.description: Conflict error response. It may occur if some of the request field(s) is not unique
